p: We also find that Penman-Monteith is more appropriate for 21 st century E 0 projections and for drought indices that use E 0, e.g., EDDI and SPEI. The 21 st century E 0 trends generated in our analysis, particularly trends in percent of historical mean and standardized anomalies, are found to be sensitive to the long-term mean value and the amplitude of interannual variability; i.e. if the magnitude of E 0 and its interannual variability are relatively low for a particular E 0 formulation, then the normalized or standardized 21 st century trend based on that formulation is more amplified relative to other formulations. We find this to be the case with the Hargreaves-Samani and Priestley-Taylor formulations, where the future standardized E 0 trends are much larger than those from Penman-Monteith.
